data.question: What is the chemical formula of the MOF prepared from a Zn:Co 1:1 molar code?
What technique was used to determine that cobalt is preferentially located in the external areas of the crystals prepared from Zn:Co molar codes?
data.answer: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and energy-dispersive x-ray spectroscopy (EDS) analyses

data.question: What causes the doubling of the c lattice parameter in the MOF prepared from a Zn:Co 1:10 molar code?
data.answer: The splitting of the crystallographic metal sites within the SBUs into alternating tetrahedral and octahedral metal sites

data.question: At what temperature does the phase transition start to occur in the Zn0.59Co0.41(hfipbb) MOF according to the variable temperature single-crystal XRD study?
What technique was used to determine the occupancy of the metal sites in the zinc-cobalt MOFs?
In the Zn0.50Mn0.50(hfipbb) MOF, zinc exclusively occupies tetrahedral sites while manganese occupies octahedral sites.
What is the role of zinc in the preparation of these multication MOFs?
data.answer: Zinc is the structure-directing element necessary to obtain the desired MOF SBU and topology

data.question: In the Zn0.64Ca0.36(hfipbb) MOF, what percentage of the octahedral sites are occupied by zinc instead of calcium?
According to DFT calculations, which hypothetical MOF phase has a higher formation energy than the original ZnPF-1 phase?
data.answer: The phase consisting of tetrahedral and octahedral zinc atoms

data.question: In the Zn0.59Co0.41(hfipbb) MOF, ferromagnetism develops within the SBUs below what temperature?
The incorporation of a second metal cation like cobalt into the MOF structure leads to a decrease in the formation energy compared to the pure zinc MOF.
What type of magnetic interaction is developed within the SBUs of the Zn0.21Co0.79(hfipbb) MOF?
In MOFs prepared from Zn:Mn:Co molar codes, cobalt can occupy both tetrahedral and octahedral sites.
What is the coordination environment of calcium when it occupies metal sites in the SBUs of the zinc-calcium MOFs?
In the Zn:Co:Ca 1:1:1 MOF, which element is preferentially located in the external shell of the crystals?
The use of manganese in the molar codes leads to a homogeneous distribution of elements in the resulting MOFs.
What two factors determine the magnetic properties of these multication MOFs at the atomic scale?
data.answer: The geometry of the SBUs and the atomic distribution of cations

data.question: Can this synthetic method be generalized to prepare new materials with rod-shaped SBUs where multiple metal cations can be arranged at desired atomic positions?
The amount of cobalt incorporated into the Zn0.59Co0.41(hfipbb) MOF increases with longer heating times up to 20 hours.
What mesoscopic property, in addition to atomic arrangement, can influence the magnetic properties of these multication MOFs?
data.answer: The possible mesoscopic interaction among SBUs
